unionImage.pl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 ######################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  A routine to make including images easier to control
00004 #
00005 #  Usage:  Image(name,options)
00006 #
00007 #  where name is the name of an image file or a reference to a
00008 #  graphics object (or a reference to a pair of one of these),
00009 #  and options are taken from among the following:
00010 #
00011 #    size => [w,h]           the size of the image in the HTML page
00012 #                            (default is [150,150])
00013 #
00014 #    tex_size => r           the size to use in TeX mode (as a percentage
00015 #                            of the line width times 10).  E.g., 500 is 
00016 #                            half the width, etc.  (default is 200.)
00017 #
00018 #    link => 0 or 1          whether to include a link to the original
00019 #                            image (default is 0, unless there are
00020 #                            two images given)
00021 #
00022 #    border => 0 or 1        size of image border in HTML mode
00023 #                            (defaults to 2 or 1 depending on whether
00024 #                            there is a link or not)
00025 #
00026 #    align => placement      vertical alignment for image in HTML mode
00027 #                            (default is "BOTTOM")
00028 #
00029 #    tex_center => 0 or 1    whether to center the image horizontally
00030 #                            in TeX mode  (default is 0)
00031 #
00032 #  The image name can be one of a number of different things.  It can be
00033 #  the name of an image file, or an alias to one produce by the alias()
00034 #  command.  It can be a graphics object reference created by init_graph().
00035 #  Or it can be a pair of these (in square brackets).  The first is the
00036 #  image for the HTML file, and the second is the image that it will be
00037 #  linked to.
00038 #
00039 #  Examples:  Image("graph.gif", size => [200,200]);
00040 #             Image(["graph.gif","graph-large.gif"]);
00041 #
00042 #  The alias() and insertGraph() functions will be called automatically
00043 #  when needed.
00044 #
00045 sub Image {
00046   my $image = shift; my $ilink;
00047   my %options = (
00048     size => [150,150], tex_size => 200,
00049     link => 0, align => "BOTTOM", tex_center => 0, @_);
00050   my ($w,$h) = @{$options{size}};
00051   my ($ratio,$link) = ($options{tex_size}*(.001),$options{link});
00052   my ($border,$align) = ($options{border},$options{align});
00053   my ($tcenter) = $options{tex_center};
00054   my $HTML; my $TeX;
00055   ($image,$ilink) = @{$image} if (ref($image) eq "ARRAY");
00056   $image = alias(insertGraph($image)) if (ref($image) eq "WWPlot");
00057   $image = alias($image) unless ($image =~ m!^/!i);
00058   if ($ilink) {
00059     $ilink = alias(insertGraph($ilink)) if (ref($ilink) eq "WWPlot");
00060     $ilink = alias($ilink) unless ($ilink =~ m!^/!i);
00061   } else {$ilink = $image}
00062   $border = (($link || $ilink ne $image)? 2: 1) unless defined($border);
00063   $HTML = '<IMG SRC="'.$image.'" WIDTH="'.$w.
00064           '" HEIGHT="'.$h.'" BORDER="'.$border.'" ALIGN="'.$align.'">';
00065   $HTML = '<A HREF="'.$ilink.'">'.$HTML.'</A>' if $link or $ilink ne $image;
00066   $TeX = '\includegraphics[width='.$ratio.'\linewidth]{'.$image.'}';
00067   $TeX = '\centerline{'.$TeX.'}' if $tcenter;
00068   MODES(
00069     TeX => $TeX."\n",
00070     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.$HTML.$eHTML,
00071     HTML => $HTML
00072   );
00073 }
00074 
00075 1;
